intro: Pseudolmedia obliqua, commonly known as the oblique pseudolmedia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely domesticated.
